instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1370: What is A1370? A1370 is a model number for a 11 inch size MacBook Air from years Late 2010, Mid 2011 with EMC 2393, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2796, 820-3024..
definitions.820-3024: What is 820-3024? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Macbook Air 11" <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1370</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only white screen
threads.message:
Hello!
I have an Macbook Air 11", <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1370</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> which turns on, fan is spinning, it chimes but only has an white screen!

I already checked all power rails => all are ok
The LVDS connector + supply is also ok.
Also no Video on external thunderbolt
SMC Reset etc, trying to boot from external USB unsuccessful.
I also checked the complete board under the microscope rigorous without any result.

I have spent already a lot of time.. but at this point I am very clueless. [IMG]http://www.badcaps.net/forum/images/smilies/cry-blow.gif[/IMG][IMG]http://www.badcaps.net/forum/images/smilies/cry-blow.gif[/IMG]

Maybe some of you has some idea or hint?
THANKS!!!

threads.title: Macbook Air 11" <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1370</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only white screen
threads.message: to me these 3024 known for bios failed. do you have donor board that has a bios to test it out?

threads.title: Macbook Air 11" <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1370</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only white screen
threads.message: No I dont have... you mean exchanging the bios IC?!

threads.title: Macbook Air 11" <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1370</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only white screen
Macbook Air 11" <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1370</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only white screen
threads.message:
Do NOT touch the BIOS!

Did you remove the SSD?

threads.title: Macbook Air 11" <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1370</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only white screen
threads.message:
Yes, I also tried erverything without the SSD.
I also noticed that I cant do any PRAM reset.

threads.title: Macbook Air 11" <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1370</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only white screen
threads.message: Removed everything and all cables? Just bare board and a known good LCD. Even the LCD can cause issues.

threads.title: Macbook Air 11" <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1370</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only white screen
threads.message: Your describing the EXACT symptoms i experienced when i did fuck with the bios... I didn't clean the me region properly, both times i did so i got what you have. Obviously deferred to the advice above however

threads.title: Macbook Air 11" <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1370</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only white screen
threads.message:
Update from my side, I replaced the BIOS chip woth a new one. Now it boots, I can start the OSX install menu etc. But the macbook just turns off during the install. I tried everything, resets etc... always same behaviour... macbook turns off during install!
Any ideas?!

threads.title: Macbook Air 11" <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1370</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only white screen
threads.message: Read original chip and post the binary here.

threads.title: Macbook Air 11" <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1370</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only white screen
threads.message: Ok, thanks... I will try to do that!
